title: Remembering William Rush: Actor's Death and Legacy at 31
summary: William Rush, a British actor best known for his role as Josh Stevenson in the BBC drama Waterloo Road, has died at the age of 31. His family, including his mother Debbie Rush—a former Coronation Street actress—announced his passing on Instagram, expressing profound grief and describing him as their 'beautiful baby boy.' Rush began his career as a child actor, appearing in series like Grange Hill and Shameless, and later took on roles in Casualty and Vera. He also auditioned for The X Factor in 2016, reaching the 'six-chair challenge' stage. The cause of death has not been disclosed. In a touching tribute, his mother highlighted his decision to become an organ donor, noting that even in death, he provided hope and life to other families. She emphasized his kindness and legacy, while requesting privacy during this difficult time. Fellow actors from Coronation Street and Waterloo Road, such as Sally Dynevor and Chelsee Healey, offered condolences and shared memories, underscoring the impact of his loss on the entertainment community. This article serves as an obituary, celebrating Rush's career and personal contributions while addressing the emotional aftermath for his loved ones.
